line.en: I went back to my room and sat down on the bed.
I've got nothing to do.
Having no club activities made me realize just\nhow long a day can be.
I take my cell phone from my pocket, and at some\npoint, I got a text.
For a moment, I thought 'Is it from Amane?' and I\nhurriedly opened the message, but...
'It's from An-chan...?'
I was a little disappointed, and while\napologizing on the inside to An-chan, I read the\ntext.
Have you met Amane yet?
'Huh?'
She was having a meeting at our factory. She said\nthat she might go over to Flying Fish Manor.
'Amane's coming...?'
The time that the text was sent was two hours\nago.
'Kanako!'
'What is it?'
'Did Amane come by?'
'Senior Mochizuki? No, she hasn't.'
'Yuka. Has senior Mochizuki been round?'
'I don't think we've had any visitors today...'
'Thank you!'
I say my thanks, then go dashng out of the\ndormitory.
'She didn't go to Flying Fish Manor?'
When I called An-chan, he went to the trouble of\ncoming round in his truck.
I got in and we drove around the station, but we\nsaw no sign of Amane.
I tried to call her but she didn't answer, so\nmaybe she'd already gotten on the train.
'Sorry, I should've called you instead of sending\na text. I didn't think that she would leave\nwithout going to see you guys.'
It looks like she had gone to An-chan's factory\nto order some parts.
There was no one else she could ask for such\ncomplex parts.
When she went to leave, An-chan asked 'Are you\ngonna go and see those guys?' and she answered\n'That's what I'm planning to do'.
However, she's quite fickle, so maybe she changed\nher mind.
I had already told Kotori and Ageha about it.
They were both happy that Amane was coming to\nKazegaura, and when they found out that she had\nleft without seeing them, they said...
I can't believe it! Amane, you idiot!
Oh no, what a shame. I wanted to see her.
and so on, expressing their regret.
'There will be one more meeting before we deliver\nthe parts. I'll let you know before then.'
'OK, thanks An-chan.'
'I'll take you back to the dormitory.'
'No, here's fine. I have some shopping to do for\ndinner anyway.'
'Sure. OK, see you next time.'
'Yeah, thanks An-chan.'
As An-chan's light truck drove away, I stood\nthere, dazed.
It was true that I had to do some shopping but I\ndidn't feel like doing it right away.
I want to see Amane... that feeling had suddenly\nbecome much stronger.
Would I be downhearted when she finds out that\nthe Soaring Club isn't doing so well?
Or do I want her to praise us for working so\nhard?
'...I'm thirsty.'
I went into the convenience store in front of me\nto buy some juice.
Then I wandered about the area.
This was to ease my feelings of not knowing what\nto do.
I'll go shopping once I've calmed down.
While I was wandering around, before I knew it, I\nfound myself at the runway.
A few days ago, we came here to cut the grass, so\nit looks quite tidy, but before that, it was\novergrown with weeds.
Between those weeds, were lines where the soil\nwas exposed.
These were marks from where the wheels of the\nglider had ran over it so many times.
Usually, a glider is launched into the oncoming\nwind.
However, because it was complicated to move the\nwinch which had been positioned there to face the\nwind, we always launched in the same direction.
I stood in the middle of the huge, wide runway,\nand gazed towards the winch.
Memories of the acceleration of being pulled by\nthe tow rope, then floating into the sky, came\nflooding back to me.
As I look up, I see the bright blue sky, and a\ntowering thunderhead.
I envision riding on the wind in the glider.
'I want to fly... in our glider.'
I've been traveling to the airfield for the\npurpose of training.
But flying in the glider that we made... is\ntotally different.
The wind that blows over Kazegaura is not the\nsame as there.
I saw someone next to the winch.
Their outline was kind of blurry because it was\nwavering in the hot air, so I couldn't see so\nwell, but...
'What are you doing?'
The cover of the winch was open, and they were\ntaking a look inside.
Was it some sort of prank, or were they trying to\nsteal the parts.
Anyway, I can't just leave this alone.
As I dashed towards them, the person closed the\ncover, then noticed me.
When there were about 300 meters between us, our\neyes met.
The next moment, the person began to wave their\nhand.
Then, they started jumping up and down.
'...Could it be?'
'Hey, is that you, Aoi?'
I was already running when I shouted out in\nsurprise.
'Huff, puff... Amane!!'
'It is you, Aoi.'
'What are you doing here?'
The first thing that I asked was a question like\nthat.
I was aware of the fact that the first thing I\nsaid after finally meeting again sounded kind of\nlike I was angry.
'I thought it would check to make sure that the\nwinch hadn't broken again.'
'It looks like it's been carefully maintained. I\ndidn't find any problems.'
'Of course!'
'Oh, I see. Yes, that's right, you guys are\ndifferent to me, You always keep everything in\norder.'
'No, I don't mean that...'
'What are you doing in a place like this!?'
'I just said, I'm checking the winch...'
'No, not that, why didn't you say anything to us,\nthen come out to a place like this?'
'You could've contacted us...'
'Oh, yeah...'
'But I thought that you would've forgotten about\nme by now...'
'How can we forget you! Aren't we always texting\nyou!?'
'Oh, you're right.'
'Those kinds of texts get mixed in with work\nrequests and demands from clients, so I often\ndon't notice them...'
'I sometimes mistakenly put them all in the trash\nfolder together...'
'I heard from An-chan that you were coming, but\nyou still didn't contact us, so I...'
'...Uh, sorry. I thought it might inconvenience\nyou if I suddenly said that I was coming.'
'So why not contact us before you come?'
'...That might also inconvenience you. I thought\nthat you would've forgotten about me...'
'I just told you...'
That was all I said, as my voice changed to a\nhuge sigh.
Common sense doesn't really work on her. This is\nAmane Mochizuki we're talking about here.
'I'm sorry, Aoi...'
'No, I'm the one who should be sorry.'
'But I've been calling you on your cell phone,\nover and over. You didn't notice that either?'
'Oh, I left my cell phone at the laboratory.'
'Why??'
'That thing is so noisy. Every day, they call to\nask how the work is coming along.'
'I don't think that cell phones and text messages\nare useful. I think they're evil things that\nconfine people.'
'Sheesh, really...?'
I hang my head in dismay.
What happened to all my impatience and\ndesperation that I had until just now?
'How have you been?'
'Yeah, pretty good. Kotori and Ageha too.'
'I see, that's good.'
'How about you, Amane?'
'I'm alright. Everyone always says 'She's the\nsame as always'.'
For some reason, Amane puffs out her chest\nproudly.
The same as always, huh? I was relieved to hear\nthat.
Not just that she's doing OK.
I thought that her being the same as always meant\nthat she hadn't changed since the time we spent\ntogether in the garage.
Amane's not a student anymore, she's part of the\nworking world now.
Which means that she's now an adult, so she lives\nin a different world to us.
'It looks like you've been maintaining the winch,\nbut there are no signs that it has been used\nrecently.'
'...Are you not flying?'
'That's right...'
After the demolition of the garage, I sent her a\ntext, briefly summarizing recent events.
If she hadn't accidentally deleted it along with\nall her work emails, she would know about that.
But most of it was good news, and I didn't really\nwrite about the bad stuff.
She's already left the school, so I didn't want\nher to make her worried about it.
I explain what had actually been going on.
'So that's what happened...'
'I'm sorry, it's my fault that this has caused so\nmany problems for everyone.'
'It's not your fault, Amane. It's nobody's fault\nreally.'
If I had to say, it was Tobioka's fault, but he\nmight have his own reasons.
The truth is, the Soaring Club garage was in the\nway of the student dormitory being built.
It's hardly ever a fair compromise when it comes\nto the needs of adults and the needs of kids.
'Today, the clouds conditions are good, and\nthere's strong airflow, so I thought that if I\ncame here, I might be able to see you flying.'
'But you haven't been able to fly since that\nday...'
Amane's expression darkens, perhaps because she\nfeels responsible.
'Oh yeah, do you have time after this? I'll call\nAgeha and Kotori, so please come to our place for\nsomething to eat.'
'I'll introduce you to our newest member too.'
'Aoi's cooking... drool.'
Amane wipes away the saliva that she had\nunknowingly let dribble out of her mouth.
'... I would really, really love to do that, but\nI have to go now.'
'I've got work to do when I get back.'
'...Oh, really?'
'Sorry.'
'It's OK.'
'...If you'd contacted us sooner...'
As I mumbled angrily, Amane seemed hurt as she\nheld her hands to her chest.
'I'm sorry...'
'Please think about it. Of course, we want to see\nyou, you know.'
'Yeah, I understand.'
The answers in a childish way, so I couldn't help\nlaughing at how funny it was.
'Well then, I'd better get going.'
'By train? I'll go with you part of the way. I\nhave to go shopping anyway.'
'OK, that would be nice.'
So that's how I had a surprise reunion with\nAmane.
'Whaaaaaaaat!!!??'
'You met Amane!!?'
'...Yeah. After that, I went to the runway and\nmet her by chance.'
'Why didn't you call us!?'
'Well, Amane had to leave...'
'It's so unfair that only you got to meet her!!'
'Yeah, I'm sorry. But it really was only for a\nshort time.'
'It looks like she'll be coming back soon, so I\ntold her to come by and see us then.'
'Ohh... I wanted to meet Amane too!!'
'Sorry.'
I feel like I'm not really to blame here, but I\napologize anyway.
I know exactly how Kotori feels.
'She's coming again, isn't she? When is she\ncoming?'
'Three days from now.'
'I can meet Amane three days from now...'
A big smile spreads across Kotori's face.
'She hardly ever replies to my texts, so I'm\ngonna give her a piece of my mind!'
'Don't go too far... Amane will probably become\nreally downhearted if you do that.'
'Whaaaaaaaat!!!??'

Damn you, Amane, I'll soon show you!'%K%P��d�3bg01�BG00_01S.PNG�LAYER_ORDER�Fbg01��������������������7st03�fEFMSK_21.PNG�ed����À?�����timer01���?timer01���d�3bg01�SKY01_01S.PNG�LAYER_ORDER�Fbg01��������������������>fEFMSK_21.PNG�ed����À?�����.(charAGE�AGE_1450.OGG�����������
��e����%LCAgeha

line.en: 'You met Amane!!?'
'...Yeah. After that, I went to the runway and\nmet her by chance.'
'Why didn't you call us!?'
'Well, Amane had to leave...'
'It's so unfair that only you got to meet her!!'
'...Why are you giving the exact same response as\nKotori?'
At school, I told Ageha the exact same thing I\nhad told Kotori the day before, and she gave\nexactly the same response.
There is a strong sense of unity in the Soaring\nClub.
'She's coming the day after tomorrow!'
'Seriously? When you say she's coming, where\nwould that be?'
'Where?'
'I think she's gonna come and eat at Flying Fish\nManor.'
Amane was drooling too.
Then, we'd be able to see those eating techniques\nof hers again, that ruin the effect of her good\nlooks.
'We might as well show her the secret base.'
'That's what I was going to say!'
'I want to show Amane what we've been doing in\nthe club.'
'Yeah, I agree.'
We all thought so subconsciously.
The thing that Amane left behind, the thing that\nwe had inherited from her...
And also, how much we'd grown.
We wanted her to see us as we are now.
'Hey, I have a suggestion.'
'What's that?'
'The truth is...'
I told everyone about the idea that had occurred\nto me the night before.
Three days later, as promised, Amane Mochizuki\ncame to Kazegaura.
'Amane!!'
'Hey, everybody. How've you been?'
'Yeah, we're doing great! Right, everyone!?'
'Yeah, she's right.'
'Quack, quack!'
'So Hat's been doing well too?'
In the afternoon, after finishing her work at\nAn-chan's factory, she came round to Flying Fish\nManor.
'How have you been, Amane?'
'Pretty good.'
'I see... Hey, could you lean forward for a\nmoment?'
'Hmm? Like this?'
'Why didn't you reply to my texts!!?'
Whack!
'Urgh!'
Right down the line where Amane's hair was\nparted, Kotori gave her a great big karate chop!
'Woah! What are you doing!?'
'Quaaaack!'
'Kotori, you idiot! What'll you do if something's\nhappened to Amane's precious brain cells!?'
'Hmph. I'll leave it at that for today.'
'Uuuh... You're so mean, Kotori...'
Amane rubs the top of her head where it had been\nchopped, with tears in her eyes.
Seeing those mannerisms makes me feel sorry for\nher.
'That's Amane...'
'She's even more strange than I thought she'd\nbe...'
'But she's pretty, isn't she? She's tall and\nseems kind too.'
'They say there's a fine line between a genius\nand... 'something else' but I'd say she's closer\nto being 'something else'.'
'Hey, we've heard everything you've been\nsaying... Including Amane.'
Well, even if she did hear, Amane doesn't seem to\nhave noticed.
'I'll introduce you! This is Asa, the newest\nmember of the club.'
'Oh, this girl?'
'...Not me.'
Asa blushed and hid behind Yoru.
'Asa, introduce yourself properly. This is our\ngreat predecessor, Amane Mochizuki!'
After being chopped on the head, it's hard to\nthink of her as our 'great predecessor', but Asa\nseems really humble in front of her.
She really is a good girl.
'N...nice to meet you, I'm Asa Kazato.'
'I'm Amane Mochizuki. Nice to meet you, Asa.'
'Oh, thank you!'
Asa is really excited by Amane being so friendly\ntowards her all of a sudden, and giving her a\nhandshake.
Because Kotori had told her so many times about\nhow great Amane is, it seemed that Asa had\nbelieved every word of it.
'Who's this?'
'I'm just some person who isn't in the club.\nDon't mind me.'
'OK, got it.'
Sarcasm doesn't work on Amane.
She just took it at face value, and seemed like\nshe wasn't worried about it at all.
'OK, let's eat right away. I'm soooo hungry!'
'Huh? What are you talking about, Amane?'
'I came here to eat Aoi's cooking.'
'You came here to meet us, didn't you!!?'
'Yeah, that too.'
She said it like she was meeting us while she on\nher way to get dinner.
'There's something we want to show you.'
'Oh really? OK, let's do that after dinner.'
'No, before dinner! Aoi, don't you have a bean\njam bun or something?'
I gave her bread that I had bought, thinking I\nwould it eat it for lunch but had forgotten\nabout.
'Here, eat this to keep your hunger at bay.'
'Wow, a green tea jam bun!'
'It's been a while since I came here.'
said Amane, as we climbed the gentle sloping path\nof Windmill Hill.
'We flew over here many times on our test\nflights, didn't we?'
Flying over here felt good, so it was a regular\ncourse when we were testing.
'Next year, a windmill that I designed is going\nto be built here.'
'Huh? Really?'
Amane nods.
'The ideas came from the things I learned about\naerodynamics from constructing the glider, and I\ntried making a new design of windmill.'
'A few experimental models will be built here.'
'They're making new windmills?'
For some reason, Asa's eyes sparkle as she joins\nthe conversation.
'Yeah, next year.'
'I drew the designs during my spare time at work,\nbut one of the other members of staff found\nthem...'
'Before I realized it, it had been decided that\nthey would actually be made.'
'Because of that, the number of calls and emails\nwith requests has been increasing...' she\nmutters.
She's still a natural-born klutz... or should I\nsay, a genius.
Then, while thinking about the windmill that\nAmane had designed, we arrived at our\ndestination.
'Here it is, Amane.'
Entering the dock, Amane looked up at the vast\nceiling.
'This is...'
'This is our new secret base.'
'Asa and Yoru let us use this place.'
Amane takes a look around at the dock's\nfacilities.
'This is amazing... This is just like the real\nthing.'
'It is, isn't it? It's all thanks to Asa!'
'Eh heh heh...'
'Thanks to this place, the plan that we've been\nworking on is proceeding smoothly.'
'The plan you've been working on?'
We grin while standing in front of the glider\nthat had positioned there.
'That's...'
'So, you finally noticed?'
'Well, we're still in the middle of it.'
While Kotori and Ageha whisper to each other,\nAmane checks over the aircraft that was in the\nmiddle of being built.
'As I thought. This is...'
'We are improving it according to the designs\nthat you left behind.'
'My designs...'
'Yes, the ones you made for Isuka.'
Ageha holds out the designs that had been put\nover there.
Amane looked at them quietly, and it wasn't clear\nif it was with a sense of nostalgia, or sadness.
'Amane is the one who made those plans.'
'Really...?'
'...You guys sure are stupid. This kind of thing\nis just armchair theory, you know.'
'No it's not! We're gonna make it a reality!'
'When we didn't have a place to carry out our\nactivities, and couldn't do anything, we talked\nabout it together.'
'How we would go about it, and if we could\nactually pull it off.'
'We carefully considered, piece by piece, the\npossibility of making the parts.'
We hypothesized the actual construction of all of\nthe parts in the plans, and carried out a\nrealistic simulation.
That was really painstaking work.
But thanks to that, we were able to confirm that\nwe could actually make it.
'That's why we can do it.'
'...Everyone...'
'We'll definitely get there! To the passage of\ncloud!'
'When that happens, you'll be there with us.'
'We will fly, bearing everyone's dreams. With\nthis thing.'
'Ha ha... you guys really are crazy after all.'
'With a leader like you, Amane, we can't help\nit!'
'Yeah, I guess you're right.'
'Sis?'
'Uh... Me too...!'
Asa held her hand up and ran towards us.
Then...
'Eeek!'
She slipped and fell over.
'A...are you OK, Asa?'
'Ow ow ow... I'm fine... But more importantly...'
'I want to fly with you too, you guys!'
'Of course. You're one of us now.'
'Yeah, she's right.'
'Hee hee... I'm so happy to hear that.'
'You've found a good base. With this place, it\nlooks like you can build it in peace.'

line.en: Amane seemed relieved as she spoke, having seen\nall of the facility, once we had moved from the\ndock to the office.
Amane must've been worried about us, which is\njust like her.
'H...here you go, Amane. Have some orange juice.'
'Thanks, Asa.'
'Eh heh heh...'
It seems like Asa has gotten quite friendly with\nher already.
'Anyway, Amane. There's something I want to talk\nto you about.'
I spoke to her in a somewhat formal tone.
Nervous expressions appeared on Kotori and\nAgeha's face.
'The reason why we brought you here, is not to\nshow you the new base.'
'It isn't?'
I nod sharply.
Then, I look at Kotori and Ageha once more, to\nconfirm our intentions.
They both looked back at me, to tell me 'Go\nahead'.
Asa just had a nervous look on her face, as she\ngripped her bottle of soda.
'Amane, can you become our advisor?'
'Advisor...?'
'Because we don't have an advisor, we can't be\nrecognized as a club, like we talked about\nbefore.'
'After that, we asked several teachers, but of\ncourse, they all refused.'
'There are no teachers with expert knowledge of\ngliders, and they would be under Tobioka-sensei's\nobservation...'
'Even if they became our advisor, it wouldn't\nmean much because they don't have the\nqualifications.'
'As far as that's concerned, you have all the\nrequired qualifications, and you have experience\nof managing a glider.'
'That's true but...'
'But I'm not a teacher, am I?'
'That shouldn't be a problem.'
I am the one who thought of this suggestion.
Before I changed schools, I was in the Cycle\nRacing Club but the coach was a pro racer who had\nbeen invited from outside the school.

Bringing in an outsider to be the coach is quite
common in top level sports clubs, and it's also
not unusual for arts-based clubs to bring in
experts.
Amane had graduated from our school, so she was\nalready very familiar with it.
This meant that the chances of it being permitted\nwhere much higher than if we were to bring in a\ncomplete outsider.
'Please, Amane! You're the only one who can do\nit!'
Seeing us all bowing our heads, Amane goes into\ndeep thought.
She walked once around the office, then picked up\nthe picture frame that was on the shelf.
'Back then...'
'...I thought that I would have nothing more to\ndo with gliders.'
'It's outside my area of expertise, and I don't\nreally like high places.'
'Also... Isuka is no longer here.'
Isuka is no longer here...?
That meant that Amane didn't have any reason to\ncontinue having anything to do with gliders.
'Amane...'
'Is that alright with you? That time, you were so\nclose to getting there.'
'We were so close but so far. I definitely think\nthat's the way it is.'
Amane speaks as if she has realized something.
'That time, inside of you, you'd already found\nthe answer.'
'Yeah.'
As Amane answered without hesitation, the rest of\nus, without knowing it, all hung our heads.
It really was all a thing of the past; Amane and\ngliders.
We kind of knew this already, but now we felt\nthat the truth we didn't want to accept, was\nright there in front of us.
Amane looked at herself in the photograph.
The picture of herself with a slightly awkward\nsmile on her face.
'...I owe you guys a favor that I can never\nrepay.'
'Now it's my turn to help you.'
'Yeah, I'll be your advisor.'
'A...alright!'
'Yes, we did it, Kotori, Aoi!'
'Yeah, we'll be able to something about it now!'
'This is so great, you guys!'
We all instinctively gave each other high-fives,\nand hugged each other to express our joy.
'Oh my god, don't scare us like that, Amane!'
'Yeah, right!'

'The truth is, well, this is about the new type
of windmill that we talked about before. As a
special training exercise, students from Keifuu
Academy will be participating in a construction
project.'
'...Oh, I might have heard about that.'
'It's a large scale training exercise, so\nstudents who wish to take part have to apply for\nit. So that's what it is...?'

The ones taking part must be mostly fourth and
fifth grade students. Even though they say
they're recruiting those who wish to take part,
they didn't ask us third graders.
I wonder where Ageha heard that rumor.
'I will be the teacher for that lesson.'
Pow! Amane proudly sticks out her chest.
Her ample chest jiggled as she did so.
'How about that, it's pretty cool, huh? I'm a\nteacher, an adult!'
As always, the thing that she's boasting about is\na bit off the mark.
Compared to teachers, those at the center of a\nbig project like this are supposed to be of an\neven higher level.
'So, you're going to be teaching lessons...?'
'Hmm, well, yeah.'
With that, Amane arches her back, pointing her\nnose to the ceiling.
The rest of us say...
'(There's no way she can do that, is there...?\nAmane's terrible at teaching people...)'
'(Unless you get used to her, it's hard to\nunderstand what she's talking about.)'
'(I feel sorry. Sorry for the top-class students\nwho have been chosen.)'
'Ha ha ha! If we meet at school, you have to call\nme Miss Mochizuki!'
'What is she saying? She repeated the year and\ncarried on going to school even though she was\nmuch too old.'
While we were having that kind of conversation...
'I see, so it's a windmill. ...And it's the one\nthat you designed.'
'Yoru, did you know about the plan?'
'Yeah. Our grandfather is the one putting up the\nmoney for the project.'
'Huh? Really?'
'The reason why Keifuu Academy students are\nparticipating is because of our grandfather's\nsuggestion.'
'It's connected to the performance of the school,\nso it's a good way to advertise it.'
'I was told to participate but I thought it was\ntoo much hassle, so I refused.'
'Oh... Is that so...?'
Now the conversation is going off on a completely\ndifferent tangent...
Well, somehow she accepted.
We've taken another step forward.
'OK, let's go back. I'm starving!'
We left to go back to Flying Fish Manor, to see\nAmane's eating style, which ruins her beautiful\nimage.
A few days later...

We boldly made a trip to the student council
room, bringing Amane with us, who had come to the
school in connection with the special training
exercise.

Then, having fulfilled all of the conditions, we
received the seal of approval from student
council president Akari Kumoi for the restoration
of the Soaring Club.
'I can't believe you dragged senior Amane back\nhere again...'

Still with an element of amazement in her voice,
Akari announced her desire to participate in the
New-type Windmill Construction Project, there in
front of Amane.
Then, the next day.
'I'm sorry.'
During lunch break, thinking that Akari had come\nto visit our class, she suddenly bowed her head\nwith a somber expression on her face.
'What's up, Akari?'
'Akari, let me take care of this!'
Masatsugu, who had been following her like a\nservant, tries to go ahead of her, but Akari\nholds him back.
'No, I'll tell them.'
'...What is this about, president?'
'It's return to the status of a club has been\nrejected in a staff meeting.'
'Whaaaat!?'
'Why is that? We fulfilled all the conditions.'
'...Strictly speaking, it hasn't been rejected\nyet.'
'Some of the teachers are strongly against it, so\nthey have yet to reach a conclusion.'
When she says 'some of the teachers', we can\nguess who she means without her having to tell\nus.
'That's no good! If it's not approved, that's the\nsame as being rejected!'
Akari gives a nod with a gloomy expression.
'We fulfilled all the conditions you gave us.\nWhat other problems could there possibly be?'
'Senior Mochizuki is a temporary teacher, and\nshe's also a very busy person.'
'The teachers who are against it said that the\nburden of being advisor might be too much.'
'That's up to Amane, though, isn't it? She said\nthat she would do it.'
'Yes, that's what I think. But the teachers\ncriticized this as being a waste of a valuable\nresource of someone like Amane Mochizuki.'
'Wait, what do they mean, a waste!?'
'You guys just shut the hell up!'
'Akari is doing everything she can for you guys!'
'She's been straight to that old man, Tobioka...'
'That's enough, Masatsugu. This is what was\narranged from the beginning.'
'...We're not blaming you, president.'
'She's right, those teachers are the ones to\nblame...'
'Isn't there something we can do, Akari?'
'I'm not planning to leave things undecided like\nthis but I don't think we can do anything about\nthis problem right away...'
'Which is why, we in the student council approve\nthe restoration of the Soaring Club to the status\nof a club.'
'This is the document issued by the student\ncouncil.'
she said as she handed us the document that was\nevidence that the Soaring Club's restoration had\nbeen approved by the student council.
It had the proper seal stamped on it too.

'It isn't much but we will give you club funds in
the student council's preliminary budget. As for
the runway, we have contacted them and received
permission for you to use it.'
'That was quick!'
'If anything happens, the student council will\ntake respsonsibility. ...I'm sorry I can't say\nmore than that, though.'
'That's why you have to be careful not to cause\nany problems as you carry out the club's\nactivities.'
'Thank you president!'
'Thank you very much.'
'Thank you!'
'Well, that's all I have to say.'
Akari gave a bow, then, dragging Masatsugu with\nher, turned to leave.
'Oh, that's right.'
'It's about the glider that disappeared from the\nschool store room.'
Gulp.
'If you happen to find it somewhere, it's yours.\nUse it however you like as equipment of the\nSoaring Club.'
said Akari, as she gave a big grin.
'Well then, if you'll excuse me.'
'...She was surprisingly accommodating.'
'...She might not seem like it, but it's like\nshe's cheering for the Soaring Club.'
'I think I kind of like her!'
So that's how our Soaring Club made a safe...\nwell, sort of... return after a one-year blank.
